sense.name: appeal, beg, or request earnestly
sense.examples: I plead with him to stop. He was on his knees, pleading for mercy. She appeared on television to plead with the kidnappers. They pled/pleaded for more time. This is a simple statement that pleads for you to take control of your life.

sense.name: offer reason as an excuse
sense.examples: It's no use pleading ignorance. Dorothy, of course, pleads stupidity because she has no idea what any of the tools do.

sense.name: LEGAL-state a plea, make allegation, present a case
sense.examples: He pled/pleaded insanity. She pled/pleaded guilty to the bank robbery. They paid a high-powered attorney to plead their case. The judge ruled her unfit to plead on the grounds of insanity.
